Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of N-acetylcysteine Plus Amiodarone for Prevention of Postoperative Atrial Fibrillation

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive N-acetylcysteine plus amiodarone or placebo plus amiodarone.

Participants.evidence: This double-blind, placebo-controlled trial included 154 patients at high risk of postoperative AF undergoing major thoracic surgery.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive N-acetylcysteine plus amiodarone or placebo plus amiodarone.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine if N-acetylcysteine reduces the incidence of postoperative AF by mitigating inflammation and oxidative stress.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was sustained AF >30 s by telemetry or symptoms requiring intervention confirmed by ECG within 7 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This double-blind, placebo-controlled trial included 154 patients.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Postoperative AF occurred in 15 of 78 patients (19%) receiving N-acetylcysteine and 13 of 76 (17%) receiving placebo.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Postoperative AF occurred in 15 of 78 patients (19%) receiving N-acetylcysteine and 13 of 76 (17%) receiving placebo (odds ratio, 1.24; 95.1% CI, 0.53â€“2.88; p = 0.615).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
